name: TaRSySAndroidORM
tagline: Yet Another Advanced ORM for Android
body: Why I created this ORM if there are already many others? I created this ORM for one simple reason ... I could not find one that would cover all my needs ... I was looking for a ORM that was easy to deploy, powerful, and without any interaction by the developer at the time of making changes to the persistent entities. How it works? First... In your project add a reference to my orm project... Next, in your Manifest file... Pay attention to meta-data tags into the application section... ```xml ``` Next in your Main Activity (usually a Splash Activity) onCreate Method, you need to write this code... ```java ... if (SGBDEngine.Initialize(this)){ ... }else{ // if the initialization was not made... } ... ``` and... next, how we create the persistent entities? it's very simple... Let's look at a simple example... ```java package com.tarsys.exampletarsysorm.entities; import com.tarsys.android.orm.annotations.DBEntity; import com.tarsys.android.orm.annotations.TableField; import com.tarsys.android.orm.enums.DBDataType; /** * Created by tarsys on 10/10/15. */ @DBEntity(TableName = "person", Description = "person entity") public class Person { //region private vars private String personalIdentification; private String name; private String lastname1; private String lastname2; //endregion public Person (String identifierPK){ this.personalIdentification = identifierPK; } @TableField(FieldName = "personal_identification", Description = "Fiscal Number identification", DataType = DBDataType.StringDataType, DataTypeLength = 30, PrimaryKey = true, NotNull = true) public String getPersonalIdentification() { return personalIdentification; } public void setPersonalIdentification(String personalIdentification) { this.personalIdentification = personalIdentification; } @TableField(FieldName = "name", Description = "Person name", DataType = DBDataType.StringDataType, DataTypeLength = 120, NotNull = true, DefaultValue = "''") public String getName() { return name; } public void setName(String name) { this.name = name; } @TableField(FieldName = "lastname1", Description = "Last Name 1", DataType = DBDataType.StringDataType, DataTypeLength = 120, NotNull = true, DefaultValue = "''") public String getLastname1() { return lastname1; } public void setLastname1(String lastname1) { this.lastname1 = lastname1; } @TableField(FieldName = "lastname2", Description = "Last Name 2", DataType = DBDataType.StringDataType, DataTypeLength = 120, NotNull = true, DefaultValue = "''") public String getLastname2() { return lastname2; } public void setLastname2(String lastname2) { this.lastname2 = lastname2; } } ``` This example can be more simple... ```java package com.tarsys.exampletarsysorm.entities; import com.github.tarsys.android.orm.annotations.DBEntity; import com.github.tarsys.android.orm.annotations.TableField; /** * Created by tarsys on 10/10/15. */ @DBEntity public class Person { //region private vars private String personalIdentification; private String name; private String lastname1; private String lastname2; //endregion public Person(){ } public Person(String identifier){ this.personalIdentification = identifier; } @TableField(DataTypeLength = 30, PrimaryKey = true, NotNull = true) public String getPersonalIdentification() { return personalIdentification; } public void setPersonalIdentification(String personalIdentification) { this.personalIdentification = personalIdentification; } @TableField public String getName() { return name; } public void setName(String name) { this.name = name; } @TableField public String getLastname1() { return lastname1; } public void setLastname1(String lastname1) { this.lastname1 = lastname1; } @TableField public String getLastname2() { return lastname2; } public void setLastname2(String lastname2) { this.lastname2 = lastname2; } } ``` And... finally... how to use it? ```java Person person = new Person(); person.setPersonalIdentification("12345678Z"); person.setName("Name"); person.setLastname1("Last Name 1"); person.setLastname2("Last Name 2"); SGBDEngine.saveEntity(person); // Gets a list of persons (all persons) ArrayList persons = SGBDEngine.filterQuery(Person.class, null,null,null, true); if (persons != null){ /// ... } // Get a person from his identifier... Person person1 = SGBDEngine.findPrimaryKeyEntity(new Person("12345678Z"), true); ``` How to integrate into android studio... i's very easy... using gradle, edit your build.gradle module and simply add this line: ```java compile 'com.github.tarsys.android:orm:1.0.0.4' ``` Note: if doesn't run directly with jcenter, try to change your project build.gradle, put your all projects section like this: ```java allprojects { repositories { mavenLocal() jcenter() maven { url "http://dl.bintray.com/tarsys/maven" } } } ``` And... that's all :D If you think I've done a good job, you can consider contributing to the development of this library.
